basic.description:
An examination and application of the principles of program planning in a variety of settings. Topics will include needs assessment, intervention design and implementation, and evaluation. Students will develop a program plan with a community organization and work toward its transformation into an active program. The application of selected program design models will serve as a basis for the course.
NOTE    In special circumstances, HLTH 315/3.0 may be taken concurrently with HLTH 415/6.0 in one's final year of the HLTH MAJ. Permission of the Undergraduate Chair in the School of Kinesiology and Health Studies is required.
LEARNING HOURS    228 (36L;24O;36Pc;132P)
basic.subject: HLTH
basic.title: Program Design and Evaluation
